or around 45 minutes from Liverpool airport

Sale is served by the excellent Metrolink tram system from Manchester city centre and other destinations in Greater Manchester.  The town has three tram stops roughly half a mile apart: Brooklands, Sale, and Dane Road. Direct 12-minute services operate to both Bury via Manchester City Centre and Manchester Piccadilly for mainline trains, this gives a 6-minute service to Manchester city centre. In the other direction there is a 6-minute service to Altrincham.

On Sundays between 07:00 and 22:30 there is a 12-minute service that currently (during the Metrolink expansion works) runs to Bury, there are no trams direct to Piccadilly from Altrincham on a Sunday. If travelling on a Sunday it is worth checking that there are not alterations to the service, again as part of the Metrolink expansion/improvement works.

Metrolink tickets
be purchased from machines on the platform before you travel.

Sale is less than a mile from junction 7 of the M60.
The A56 runs to both Manchester and Altrincham.
Sale has many bus services including connections to both Manchester and Altrincham.

value: File:Bridgewater Canal in centre of Sale 2006.jpg
content=A pleasant walk through along the towpath, north to Stretford and Manchester or south to Altrincham.
Passes next to the Bridge Inn pub and runs parallel and adjacent to the Tram line for much of its route.

content=Over a hundred years old and still the centre of Sale's wildlife, in amongst the pleasant grounds, there are many breeds of birds and squirrels on view. Also, a skate ramp, play areas and statue to the Physicist JP Joule
content=The water park is open throughout the year, allowing canoeing, boating, surfing and a host of water based activities. Lessons and guides can be pre-booked.
Very popular with dog walkers, joggers and bird watchers and has its own angling club.
directions=Brooklands Metrolink Station is close by.
content=Playing fields and Park adjacent to Bridgewater Canal; miniature railway giving rides every Sunday
address=Heywood Road, Brooklands, Sale, Greater Manchester, M33 3WB
directions=The nearest Metro stop is Brooklands on the Altrincham line.

content=One of the world's oldest rugby union clubs, Sale FC is a "Member Owned" Club founded in 1861 and they have played at Heywood Road since 1905/06. They currently play in the National 3 North league.

Sale is not normally thought of as a shopping destination although it does have plenty of supermarkets and other shops for one's everyday needs. 
Unfortunately, the nearby Trafford Centre or Manchester City Centre are the preferred destinations.
Sale has a wide variety of restaurants and take-aways with food from all over the world.
